questions.question: Sideways shows the highest percentage of days. Why might that be?
options: Markets trend strongly most of the time
Short-term mean reversion and noise dominate many periods
Bear markets last 90% of the time
questions.explanation: Most days are choppy/noisy; persistence in middling state is common.

questions.question: If Bull avg return=2.04% and volatility=3.58%, what is a simple Sharpe proxy (return/vol)?
What does high persistence but negative average return imply for Bear?
questions.answer_text: Losses can compound if you fight a stable down regime.
